chat.msg: hey, q tal? empezamos el juego?
Empecemos!
great! I see a kind of twig that leads to an island with a tiger
Should we go that way or choose another path?
We should go that way for sure.
Muy bien, ahora estamos en la isla de este tigre.
Veo una mariposa en una pequeña isla al sureste y una isla grande con un loro en un árbol al suroeste. ¿Adónde vamos ahora?
Vamos a la isla del loro!
ready, we are on parrot island
I see a trio of rocks to the southeast, an elephant to the left. boost us from here?
Go around the parrot tree toward the three rocks.
Entendido, ahora estamos al lado de las 3 rocas.
cual es el camino?
Cruza usando las rocas hacia la isla con la rana.
okay, we're on the frog island now
what's the next step, friend?
No we need to use the crocodie to cross toward elephant island again.
done, we've reached elephant island again
we've got a crocodile on one side and same elephant on the other. which way now?
We go straight ahead toward the two rocks. We have to cross to get to giraffe island!
Muy bien, llegamos a la isla de la jirafa.
Ahora tenemos que cruzar a la isla de las viboras usando la ramita.
ok, cruzamos la ramita y ahora estamos con la serpiente
Sigue derecho y encontraras el tesoro!
We found the treasure! good job buddy
*finished*
hey there, estas listo?
Listisima!
bright! First, take a few steps to the left, passing under a wooden bench and cross a path towards a flower shop. but wait, don't go to the store
make a u-turn to the left, cross the path again and head back towards the white dog. You are in the right place?
I'm back with the white dog
¡buen trabajo! ahora cruza esa rama cerca de ti, dirigiéndote hacia el sur
Continúe hasta que vea otro perro blanco con un arreglo para picnic.
Listo, encontre el segundo perro.
perfect! Now, get over that picnic blanket.
Does something feel strange under your feet? Yes, they are the fruits of the forest, but continue towards the west
Should I gross any bridges?
si claro! Deberías ver un puente de madera cruzando un río, en dirección norte.
adelante, cruzalo
Listo, estoy en la isla de la floreria.
great! avoid that green plant, but walk around to the right until you reach a flower shop
You see it?
I see it.
¡perfecto! Ahora, dirígete hacia el oeste, pasando por debajo del puesto de flores.
Sigue adelante hasta que veas un gran puente con dos ciclistas en él.
Lo cruzo?
no need to cross it, just pass it on the west side
keep going!
I don't understand. I shouldn't cross the bridge?
mis disculpas si parece confuso. no debes cruzar el puente
solo quiere pasar por el lado oeste, mantenerte en el mismo lado del río. ¿ves a dos señores mayores leyendo en un banco después del puente?
Entonces tengo que cruzar nadando?
no no wait! By the "west side of the bridge" I meant that you arrived at the bridge and then continued along the same bank of the river, following the route that goes west.
no need to swim! you did?
In order to do that, I have to cross the river. The only way to cross the river other than using the bridge, is to swim.
oh, lo siento si ha habido alguna confusión. No necesitas cruzar el río. solo sigue caminando más allá del puente
o mar, pase el puente y continúa por la costa del río. Entonces deberías ver a la pareja de ancianos. ¿despejado ahora?
hi there, empezamos?
Hola! Empecemos!
sweet! okay, I'm in the store in the north of the map
Where should I go from here?
Do you see the tent?
¡Sí, lo tengo! ¿Debería dirigirme hacia allí?
No, ahi es donde empiezas.
Gotcha, I'm at the tent now
what's next, friend?
De ahi, camina hacia el sur y veras un perro a tu izquierda.
okay, i see the pooch now! it's next to a fire
what's the next step, friend?
Walk toward the east and you will see a firepit. Go around it by heading northeast  until you reach the pair of red mushrooms.
Oye, pasé el fuego y ahora estoy parado al lado del hongo rojo.
Bueno, sigue al este hasta que llegues al carro azul  vas a hacer una vuelta en u.
alright, estoy en el auto azul ahora
¿dónde voy desde aquí?
Make a u-turn toward the road that goes south.
Vale, hice el cambio de sentido. Me dirijo al sur ahora
Puedes ver un telescopio azul. ¿Adónde vamos ahora?
Ok, sigue hacia el telescopio pero no sigas el camino. Vas a tomar un atajo al lado del telescopio hasta que veas el camino de nuevo.
genial, gracias compadre! pasé el telescopio y ya veo el camino de nuevo
Sigue el camino hasta que veas unas grandes rocas, y sigue hasta que llegues a la cabaña
I have it! I see the rocks and in the middle is the wooden cabin
I'm there! *finished*
hola, q tal? ready to play?
I'm ready!
¡impresionante! Primero, dirígete hacia el suroeste y pasa por debajo de la primera palmera.
luego gire a la derecha, cruce la segunda palma y gire bruscamente a la izquierda antes de la tercera. continúa hacia el sur
Listo
great! Now look at the little brown puppy next to you.
pass it on the left, make a slight turn to the left and then to the right towards the south
Que hago ahora?
Now, you will find large rocks to your west and a small one to your east.
pass between them and you will reach the water
I've reached the water.
¡buen trabajo! Verás un gran cangrejo rojo.
Lo veo.
turn right, walk along the big rock and keep heading west in the water
Veo un tiburon.
that's correct! now, make a sharp turn to the right
Veo un balon de voleibol
nice! now go back to land, cross between the medium rock and the volleyball
then head up north
Listo. Veo una bocina
perfect! shift slightly to the north-west now
pass between the red tent on your left and that speaker you already found
Listo
now, you see the ocean again, right? don't reach the water
stay close, head south, and then turn west just at the shore. you see the red kayak?
I do not see the ocean. I am far from the ocean.
culpa mía. necesitas dar vueltas alrededor de la tienda correctamente
Intente trazar un arco alrededor de la tienda y luego diríjase hacia el sur. Entonces el océano debería estar justo frente a ti.
Ok, veo el kayak.
great! pass under the kayak and take a right turn, heading north
Ready
¡dulce! Termina avanzando por el kayak hasta llegar al pequeño arbusto verde.
¡Lo has logrado, amigo mío!

When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.

When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?
When you hear others mixing languages in conversation, how do you feel about it?
How natural was your conversational partner’s language switching?

general_survey.answer: The way my partner was switching languages was acceptable to me. I don't like when, for example, two words are in English then you add a Spanish one, then you go back to english. I'd rather have full conversations in either language, not mixing them, though.
general_survey.question: Any final comments about your partner’s language switching?

general_survey.answer: My native language is Spanish and I speak it with my maternal and paternal families even if they speak English. I grew up in a family of Spanish speakers so it's comforting to continue speaking Spanish with them.
general_survey.question: Any final comments about your language background?
